project.adb
Class Site

java.lang.Object
  project.adb.Site

public class Site
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds all the info for each Site. It maintains its own lock table and keeps track of which indexes are ready to be read in case of a failure/recovery. Sites have two states: ready and failed. When a site fails it loses its lock table.

Author:
Darren Levy, Viswanath Kammula

removeReadLocksAtIndex

public void removeReadLocksAtIndex(int index)
Author: Darren Since read locks can be shared, each index has a list of read locks. This method will clear that list at a given index.

Parameters:
index - the index to remove any read locks

writeValueAtIndex

public void writeValueAtIndex(int index,
                              int value)
Author: Darren and Viswanath When a value is written to a site its index is ready to be read again. This takes place at the end of the transaction when the values can be committed.

Parameters:
index - the index to write
value - the value to write

Author: Darren

Parameters:

Returns:
the value committed to the given index

fail

public void fail()
Author: Darren and Viswanath When a Site fails, its read and write lock tables must be cleared and all the replicated indexes are unable to be read.

isReadyToBeRead

public java.lang.Boolean isReadyToBeRead(int index)
Author: Darren

Parameters:
index - the index to check if it's ready to be read
Returns:
true or false depending on if the given index is ready to be read or not

recover

public void recover()
Author: Darren and Viswanath When a site recovers its state is set to ready and its waiting transactions get promoted.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Author: Darren

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string containing the state and value at each index along with the locks held at each index.
